headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Robinhood Markets (HOOD) After Its Sharp Recent Pullback?
summary: If you are wondering whether Robinhood Markets is still worth your attention after a big run in the past, this article will help you focus on what the current share price might mean for value. The stock recently closed at US$80.62, with a 22.0% decline over the last 7 days, a 34.6% decline over 30 days, a 30.0% decline year to date, a 48.7% gain over the last year, and a very large 3 year return. headline: Strategy Slides Even Further on Earnings Miss After Dismal Day
summary: Shares of  Strategy  one of the largest holders of  Bitcoin  worldwide, fell nearly 5% in after-hours trading after a rough day that saw its stock plummet 17% as broader stock market jitters spooked crypto investors.  The company, which owns nearly 4% of the total Bitcoins currently in circulation, reported a per share loss on a generally-accepted accounting basis of $42.93 and revenue of $123 million.  While the loss widely missed analyst expectations for a loss of just eight cents a share, revenue beat analyst expectations for $119 million.

headline: Robinhood, Coinbase, Circle shares slide after Bitcoin crash
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) plunged beneath the $70,000 mark on Jan. 5, shedding roughly 8% over the past 24 hours in its steepest drop since early November 2024. headline: Best Stocks to Buy in the Selloff: Buy HOOD Down 50% Before Earnings?
summary: HOOD transformed from an upstart stock-trading app into an S&P 500 giant and a direct competitor to Fidelity and others. Its growth outlook remains strong, and investors might want to buy the stock down roughly 50% from its highs.

headline: Bitcoin's monthslong slide continues, hitting fresh 15-month low of $67,000
summary: The price of bitcoin continued its monthslong slide Thursday, falling another 11% to $67,000, its lowest level in 15 months.  After the election of President Donald Trump in November of 2024, Bitcoin prices chugged higher for the better part of a year, in part due to investors' expectations of a more crypto-friendly administration in Washington.  Companies that enable investors to buy and sell cryptocurrencies, as well as the growing number of companies who have made investing in bitcoin their main business focus, have also been hit hard in the recent sell-off.
